channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed, no mot car been dumped/abandoned here!!!, 15th January
item.description:

item.title: Dog Owners Failing to Pick up Poo, 15th January
item.description:
Several dog owners fail to pick up their dog poo, which adorns the middle of the pavements around Montpelier Road, King's Grove and mostly along Queen's Road. It is revolting. There has to be a solution to this, whether it is fines, more public rubbish bins, or free bags on lamp posts... or education and having pride in your neighbourhood. It's rare to see a whole poo - it's always been accidentally stepped in, which is a rotten start or end to any day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpelier Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter blackspot, 15th January
item.description:
Litter builds up here almost dail at this corner. People sit in the wall and juck their litter. Please consider moving the nearby litter bin currently outside Tesco on Battersea Bridge Road to this corner. More visible and in an area where people litter all the time. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Surrey Lane, Battersea, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More issues from little birches building, 15th January
item.description:
Once more there is debris stretching from little birches to marechal Neil road. Some rocks look about 20cm big. Verges mounted again and damage being caused to Harland and likely vehicles. It’s an accident waiting to happen. Today I noticed a man with a spade attempting to clear little birches only. The debris/damage to Harland is about 100-150 meters long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clothes dumped next to the AWFUL clothes bin, 15th January
item.description:
Every day people dump things next to this bin. It's a disgrace. We're trying to run a business and when clients visit it's horrendous. These bins are a magnet for anything and everything being dumped. I wonder if the company that puts these bins everywhere has one outside their head office?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Blackfriars Road, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pot Hole, 15th January
